result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:01 AM Defendant Isaak J Hall in court with attorney Chelsea Payant.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attny Payant has copy of complaint, waives reading, requests status. Court advises Def. right to a prelimintary hearing.   Def. waives time limits for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing and sets for status conference.  Discussion as to bond. Court orders that bond will continue as is with same conditions.  Court will leave no contact in bond as originally set in GF file. State has complied with victim rights.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Isaak J Hall
Current: 517 Watson St, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 1316 Clermont Street, Antigo, WI 54409

No contact with alleged victim with includes to family wizard.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No dangerous weapons.

Def. appears via video from Langlade County Jail with Attorney Chelsea Payant.  Kelly Hays, via zoom.  State does riverside hearing and possible charges, Theft to Injury, Domestic, False Imprisonment, domestic, and D.C. domestic.  State gives probable cause. State gives bail/bond recommendation, $2,000 cash bond, No contact with victim, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No use or possess dangerous weapons. Court finds standards for riverside finding and finds probable cause. Atty Payant gives bail/bond argument. State replys to conditions. Court gives factors for bond and orders $1,0000 cash bond, no contact with victim with includes to family wizard,   Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no dangerous weapons.  State makes statement.  Atty Payant makes statement.
